metadata.synopsis: Blinded at the abusive hands of her mother as a young girl, Emma Brody (Madeleine Stowe) is now a musician in Chicago. After an operation, she partly regains her sight, but sometimes she can remember things only hours after first seeing them. When she thinks she sees the person who murdered her neighbor, the police detective John Hallstrom (Aidan Quinn) becomes involved both with the case and with Emma. Now the killer is after Emma, and John struggles to protect her as they unravel the mystery.

reviews: ...an interesting premise that's employed to mostly engaging effect...
That Emma defends herself in the end can provide no real redemption for a character who has been consistently compromised by her creators.
Michael Apted's Blink walks a fine line, but if you're willing to accept it on its frankly formulaic terms, it delivers some good jolts.
A thriller that fails at the death sounds disastrous, but this one is well worth watching.
A better film than you'd think, with good, tense performances by Stowe and Quinn.
Generic thriller saved by a few strong performances.
